coconut.name: Coconut Oil
coconut.description: [Foundation] Strong cleansing power, produces large and rich bubbles. Essential foundation oil for making soap hard.

palm.name: Palm Oil
palm.description: [Foundation] Provides hardness to the soap, preventing it from melting or deforming easily. Fine bubbles.

olive.name: Olive Oil
olive.description: [Foundation] Rich in vitamins and squalene. Mild feeling, suitable for infants and sensitive skin.

avocado.name: Avocado Oil
avocado.description: [Premium Moisturizer] Deep cleansing, extremely mild. Rich in Vitamin A, D, E. Great for allergy-prone or dry skin.

macadamia.name: Macadamia Oil
macadamia.description: [Premium Moisturizer] King of anti-aging. Rich in palmitoleic acid, close to human sebum, easily absorbed.

hazelnut.name: Hazelnut Oil
hazelnut.description: [Premium Moisturizer] Moisturizing and refreshing. Excellent penetration, does not clog pores.

apricot.name: Apricot Kernel Oil
apricot.description: [Premium Moisturizer] Light and breathable. More refreshing than sweet almond oil, rich in minerals.

sweet_almond.name: Sweet Almond Oil
sweet_almond.description: [Premium Moisturizer] Soft and smooth feeling, softens skin and improves dryness.

cocoa_butter.name: Cocoa Butter
cocoa_butter.description: [Texture Adjuster] Increases hardness and protective film. Suggest 5~15% addition.

mango_butter.name: Mango Butter
mango_butter.description: [Texture Adjuster] Gentler than cocoa butter. Good moisturizing effect, increases smoothness.

shea_butter.name: Shea Butter
shea_butter.description: [Texture Adjuster] Protective barrier, anti-allergic, creamy wash feel. Rich in non-saponifiable matters.

jojoba.name: Jojoba Oil
jojoba.description: [Texture Adjuster] Liquid wax, hair miracle. Forms a protective layer, often used for superfatting.

neem.name: Neem Oil
neem.description: [Special Treatment] Antibacterial and insect repellent. Great for eczema and acne.

wheatgerm.name: Wheatgerm Oil
wheatgerm.description: [Special Treatment] Antioxidant, rich in Vitamin E. Delays rancidity of soap.

evening_primrose.name: Evening Primrose Oil
evening_primrose.description: [Special Treatment] Improves atopic dermatitis. Rich in linoleic acid, easily oxidized.

rosehip.name: Rosehip Oil
rosehip.description: [Special Treatment] Repairs scars, whitening. Helps fade fine lines and pigments.

castor.name: Castor Oil
castor.description: [Special Treatment] Increases bubble quantity and persistence. Produces silk-like dense bubbles.

camellia.name: Camellia Oil
camellia.description: [Local & Affordable] Oriental Olive Oil. Great for hair and scalp. Refreshing than olive oil.

camellia_oil.name: Camellia Oil
camellia_oil.description: [Premium Hair Care] Also known as bitter tea oil. Excellent for hair and scalp, refreshing and moisturizing.

canola.name: Canola Oil
canola.description: [Local & Affordable] Training oil, highly moisturizing. Affordable price, fine and mild bubbles.

lard.name: Lard
lard.description: [Local & Affordable] Traditional, extremely hard. Dense bubbles, snow-white and mild soap body.

powder.reason: Surface contact with air, insufficient insulation, excessive water
powder.solution: Cut off the surface. Spray alcohol or seal with plastic wrap next time.

sponge.reason: Insufficient mixing, low temperature causing oil-lye separation
sponge.solution: Failure. Can be grated and hot-processed into re-batched soap.

sweat.solution: Wipe dry. Use a dehumidifier to keep dry.

seperation.solution: Pour back into pot and continue mixing to Trace.

volcano.reason: Excessive temperature, high sugar content in honey/milk
volcano.solution: No insulation needed for sugar/milk soaps. May even need refrigeration.

ui.hardness_tip: Durability and hardness of the soap body
ui.creamy_tip: Ability to protect small bubbles from breaking

marseille.name: Classic Marseille (72% Olive)
marseille.description: Most classic formula, extremely mild and moisturizing.

cleansing.name: Extra Cleansing (Laundry/Shampoo)
cleansing.description: High coconut oil ratio, providing powerful cleaning.

moisturizing.name: High Moisturizing (Dry Skin)
moisturizing.description: Includes Shea Butter and Avocado oil, great for autumn/winter.

app.title: Master Soap Maker
app.library_desc: Learn about oil properties and market prices
app.status_desc: All formulas and cost estimates are completed locally. Data is private and offline-compatible.
app.copyright: For educational use only. Wear protective gear when handling chemicals.
app.footer_note: Educational purposes only. Please wear safety gear.

calculator.ins_tooltip: INS value represents the soap hardness. Recommend 120-170.
calculator.insight_conditioning: Extremely moisturizing, very suitable for dry skin or winter use.
calculator.insight_cleansing: Powerful cleansing, feels refreshing, best choice for summer.
calculator.insight_balanced: All data are balanced, suitable formula for all skin types.
calculator.insight_ins_low: Current INS is low, recommend extending curing time for better hardness.
calculator.notes_hint: Suggest recording: Temp, Humidity, Mixing time, Insulation method.
calculator.empty_desc: Add oils below or use presets to start your journey.
calculator.save_modal_desc: Save to your private recipe library
calculator.cost_tip: Adjusting olive or coconut oil proportions is usually the quickest way to control costs.

production.title: Production Order
production.temp_desc: Best temperature range for oil-lye mixing to ensure reaction smoothness.
production.safety_goggles: Wear safety goggles during entire process
production.step_lye_desc: Add NaOH into water (NEVER add water to NaOH!) and stir until transparent.
production.step_oil_desc: Heat and dissolve solid oils, mix with liquid oils, adjust to match lye temp.
production.step_mix_desc: Slowly pour lye into oils, stir continuously until it reaches Trace.
production.step_mold_desc: Add scents or additives, stir well, pour into mold and tap gently.
production.unmold_desc: Insulate for 24h after molding. Improper insulation may cause soda ash or glycerin rivers.
production.safety_reminder: Make sure goggles, mask, and gloves are ready.
production.safety_msg_beginner: NaOH is highly corrosive! Always add NaOH to water. Wear goggles and gloves. Rinse immediately if contact occurs.
production.safety_msg_expert: NaOH is corrosive. Wear long sleeves, goggles, and gloves. Use in well-ventilated areas.
production.step_lye_prep: Make lye solution: add NaOH to water
production.step_mold_insulate: Pour into mold and insulate for 24-48h

safety_alert.title: Safety First: NaOH Usage Guidelines
safety_alert.order_desc: Always add NaOH to water. NEVER add water to NaOH to avoid splashing and burns.
safety_alert.ventilation_desc: Lye solution produces fumes. Operate under a hood or outdoors, avoid direct inhalation.
safety_alert.protection_desc: Wear goggles and gloves throughout. Rinse immediately with plenty of water if splashed.
safety_alert.material_desc: DO NOT use aluminum. Recommend 304 stainless steel or heat-resistant PP5 / Glass.
